TextView.android:text: Attempting to wholly understand this movement can truly be overwhelming. There is so much to learn and so much information readily available that it can often be confusing to know how to actually make a difference. If you are here reading and looking for ways to help out, you have already taken the first step of helping out. Being educated on this matter is highly important before you can go out and make change. Now that you have a decent understanding of what this movement is about, there are a few other steps you can take that would really help make an impact on the world.

The four key things that any person can do to help is to donate, sign petitions, show up to protests, and vote if you are old enough to. If you are able to do any or all of these things, it will help make a truly lasting change in our country. It is time we see real change for all of these movements and down below is how you can do your part. It is also important to just reach out and check in on friends and family. Share your resources and have difficult conversations with the more close-minded people of our societies. Be an ally in any way possible because staying silent only adds to the oppressions that have already been going on for much too long.

Donating is a crucial part of every movement. Notable organizations already fully commit to this cause and do incredible work and even the smallest donation can help advance significant changes in our society. Aside from donating money, you can also donate your time to these organizations who are always looking for volunteers to help out.
Rape, Abuse, and Incest National Network (RAINN)

Petitions are a great way to show your support for important movements, including the MeToo movement. By signing some of the petitions below, you are becoming part of a team that is aimed to make a change for all women in the world. Here are some links to sign below.

When someone experiences a traumatic event like sexual assault it is very difficult for that person to ever fully recover and gain the courage to stand up for themselves. The Me Too movement exemplified how society instils a fear in survivors that keeps them from sharing their stories. We must stand in solidarity with these victims to provide them the strength to rise up and face their perpetrators. When there is a protest or march or rally, people must show up and prove to the oppressors that think they got away with their horrendous actions and to convince them that there will be consequences for such horrible and disgusting behavior that ruins victims' lives. It is time for change and it is time to put an end to the suffering of many women across the world. If change is created now then future generations of women will not have to live in fear of being sexually assaulted throughout their lifetime.

99.5% of rapists get away with their crime. 99.5% of sexual assault victims never got the justice they deserved. 99.5% of guilty criminals walk free to this day. 99.5% of survivors live in fear of seeing their perpetrator. Our justice system is continually failing victims of sexual assault everyday. Many people shy away from reporting their abuse because of statistics like the ones above. They do not believe or trust that justice will be served even if they report their harasser. This is the biggest reason why people must vote officials into power that they trust will make a change happen. Letting 99.5% of people that commit a crime walk free should be a crime in itself. So many women have to face their abuser everyday and for the rest of their lives simply because justice was not served.

The power to vote is not something that should be taken lightly. It gives people more power than he or she realizes to help create real change. Voting for bills and local community leaders is a great way to support the Me Too movement. Vote for officials who are supportive of the community and are willing to pass laws to create equal rights for them. Vote for bills that actively try to stop discrimination, in any way, against these individuals.
